name: Scoop grip DLR Back Take
why: x
description: Reach under for the Scoop grip. Reach for the far hip, switch to crab ride.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Scoop DLR Waiter Sweep
why: They push your far foot down and step over it.
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Switch to K Guard
why: They push your far foot away.
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Switch to SLX with Outside Reap
why: They try to stack you
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Outside Reap
why: x
description: Bring the leg over the top to break them down with the Outside Reap.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Ghost hook Ankle Lock transition
why: They block your reaping leg
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Scoop Grip Single Leg X Transition
why: They push your far foot off their hip
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: SLX Ankle Pick
why: They close their knees so you can't split their legs
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Shoulder Crunch Razor Armbar
why: x
description: Take a 2 on 1 grip high on the shoulder, and pass your far leg over the head. Rotate towards that far leg and finish right above the elbow.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Shoulder Saddle transition
why: They boot their arm through and bend it
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Deep Half transition
why: They get a deep underhook
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Octopus Guard Transition
why: You can't get the underhook, they are pressuring down
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Mikey Lock Inside Heel Hook
why: x
description: Free your knee and drop it to the mat, underhook the ankle, and place your opponent's foot behind your head. Take your outside foot and reap it through, under your opponent's knee. Raise the heel with your bottom hand, while reaching around the foot as deep as you can with the other hand to finish.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: 70/30 Mikey Lock Inside Heel Hook
why: They block your reaping leg
description: As you try to weave your leg into the reap, they block it or drag your leg across their hip. Triangle your legs on the far side while keeping your knee on the mat. Finish the heel hook as before.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Philly Saddle
why: They put thier foot down behind your knee
description: Trap the foot with your knee. Reach across and capture the far leg, dragging it across to the other side. Shoot your far leg through and re-triangle your legs, then reach back for the Heel Hook.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Body Triangle Rear Naked Choke
why: x
description: Get the bottom underhook and the bottom wrist, pass your foot across to close the Body Triangle. Switch the grip to the other wrist, and come over the top with your free arm and attack the neck with the RNC.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Arm Trap Rear Naked
why: They don't let you Body Triangle
description: They don't let you Body Triangle, so take both handcuff grips on thier respective wrists. Push the top arm down and trap it with your foot, bringing your other foot on top to secure the trap. Come over the top to finish the RNC.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Arm Trap Triangle
why: They sneak their shoulder out of your Arm Trap
description: As you are trying to trap their top arm, they sneak their shoulder down and out. Force their bottom arm behind their head, and grab your own shin, as your lock up the triangle.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Re-take the Back
why: They escape your underhook on bottom side.
description: Drive your top arm through and connect your hands. Drive them forward, as you slide your bottom leg under their head, and pull up on their head and arm, as you retake the back on the other side.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Double Unders Bully Sweep
why: x
description: Get Double Underhooks, sit up heavy and pull into the small of your Opponent's back, as you come up on top.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Elevate and Switch to single leg X
why: They lean forward heavily
description: Elevate and Switch to single leg X
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Butterfly Hook Sweep
why: They pummel an Underhook
description: Butterfly Hook Sweep
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Choi Guard Kimura
description: Catch the wrist and reach over for the Kimura grip. Raise the wrist to the ceiling to finish.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Tarikoplata
why: They hide their wrist
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: ChoiBar
why: They hide their wrist and trap your bottom foot
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Triangle
description: Reach up on one side and take a grip behind their head, in the front of their far armpit. Clamp your knee and elbow together, trapping the arm. On the far side, frame with your elbow on their arm, opening it up and creating space for you to jump your leg over their arm, catching it with your other hand. Lock up the triangle and pull down on the head to finish.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Closed Guard Armbar
why: They drive their elbow down
description: Reach across the back, hooking your fingers in their armpit. Open your guard and jump the shoulder. Dive under their nearside knee and anchor yourself, as you pass your leg over their head to finish the Armbar.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Flower sweep armbar
why: They posture up as you shoulder lock
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Back Take
why: They stack you
description: As they stack you, come out the backdoor, slipping your head out from under them and climbing the back.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Crab Ride Back Take
why: x
description: Force your opponent to one side, driving their foot to the mat, as you come up on top on the Back.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Leg Drag
why: They run from your hook
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Butterfly Tilt Sweep
why: x
description: Pummel for the underhook. With your other hand, take a grip right above their elbow. Turn them down and sweep.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Single Leg X (Scoop Grip)
why: They post with their leg
description: Underhook the leg to Single Leg X (Scoop Grip)
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: They free their arm and post
why: Shoulder Lock Position
description: Underhook the arm to Shoulder Lock
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Inside Heel Hook
why: x
description: Gather both legs. Roll belly down so you can triangle your legs. Come back and dig for the heel with your elbow.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Outside Reap Heel Hook
why: They escape their far leg and start to free their knee
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Chase their back
why: They escape their knee to the inside.
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Inverted Guard Toe Hold
why: x
description: Take a grip on the toes with your inside hand, pointing the foot inside. With your free hand, reach over with a kimura like grip on your own wrist. Push your foot towards their butt to finish.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Hogtie Sweep
why: They run from the Toe Hold
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Inside Reap
why: They free one leg
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: K Guard Outside Reap
why: x
description: Take a 2 on 1 grip right above their knee, and pull it onto your stomach. Push off the mat with your inside foot, and throw your outside leg over the top and under their far knee if posible.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Crab Ride transition
why: They resist your elevation but you get their knee on your stomach
description: Reach over for their heel, and pull their leg across, hiding your knee behind their knee and moving to Crab Ride.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Matrix to backside 50/50
why: They step their far leg back and cut an angle away from you
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

sub: Attacking from Cross Ankle X Guard
name: Cross Ankle Getup
why: x
description: With the crossgrip, throw in your bottom foot across your opponent's far hip, then put your top foot behind their knee. Use the hooks to pull and then push, creating the momentum to come up on top into leg drag.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Shallow Philly Saddle to 70/30
why: They bring their outside foot over the top.
description: As they bring the foot over the top, pull it through. Fire your leg through and over their waist to 70/30.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Inside Reap Snag
why: They bring their outside foot underneath.
description: As they bring their outside foot underneath, make room by raising your foot and putting it under their knee. Pull the leg through and snag the inside reaping heel hook.
b1: Continue to: Attacking from Inside Reap
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Backstep to the Inside Reap
why: They begin turning away from the cross side grip.
description: As They begin turning away, your foot moves from under one of their knees, to under the other knee. As you feint going belly down, and then backstep to capture the far leg in the Inside Reap.
b1: Continue to: Attacking from Inside Reap
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Switch foot 70/30
why: They push your foot off their hip and try to stand up.
description: As they push the foot down, try to stablize it with your other foot. As this fails, replace it with your other foot, and turn your knee down to the mat, as you throw your other foot over the top for the 70/30.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Americana
why: x
description: Pin your opponent's arm down with your cross arm, then go 2 on 1. Bring your free hand under their elbow, and make a Kimura like grip on your own wrist. Raise the elbow to finish.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Switch grip Americana
why: They hand fight and bring their wrist inside.
description: Use your opposite wrist to pin their arm down, using your other hand to post and balance. Switch your hands on the wrist and finish the Americana as normal.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Gift Wrap back take
why: When you pin the wrist down, they connect their hands.
description: As they bring their other arm across the connect their hands, pressure down on it and take a Gift Wrap, Kimura like Head & Arm grip on their top arm. Throw your top leg over, slide your bottom leg under their head, and pull up on the Gift Wrap to take the back.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Knee on Belly Switch
why: They start getting under your knees with their elbows
description: As soon as you start feeling like they are starting to get under your knees with their elbows, windshield wiper the foot (on the side they are turning towards) to the other side of their body where your other foot is, and switch to Knee on Belly.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: North South Choke
why: x
description: Reach around the head, and drop your lat onto their face, using it to turn their face away. Circle towards their head, as your grab their wrist with your free hand and get it out of the way, placing your head in front of it, isolating their head.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Knee pin Darce
why: They defend with the nearside arm, deep
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Spin to far side Side Control
why: The defend with the far arm
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Head and arm Darce
why: They defend with the nearside arm, deep
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Octopus Bump Sweep
why: x
description: While reaching around the back, throw in the lockdown on their far leg. On the nearside, pull in on thier knee while you Hip Bump them forward.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Octopus roll through
why: They Pressure forward
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Octopus Getup
why: You lose the hook
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Cartwheel Triangle/Armbar
why: They crossface and you lose the hook
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Outside Ashi Heel Hook
why: x
description: As soon as you get into Outside Ashi, immediately dig for the heel, secure the grip, and twist upward to finish.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Low Ankle Lock
why: You lose the heel
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Z Lock Heel Hook
why: x
description: Gather both legs and push down on your opponent's foot to get the tap.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Outside Heel Hook
why: They kick their leg straight.
description: If they kick their leg straight, dig for the heel. Lock the grip and turn up to finish.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Kiss of the Dragon Back Take
why: x
description: Kick your legs and pull on their leg to offbalance them. When they push back into you, dive between their legs, reaching behind their far knee, and then replacing that hand with your knee. Reach up for a grip on their hip, as you keep the other leg jacked up with your underhook. Hammer down on the back of the knee with your leg, as you come up and put your hook in on that side.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Tight Waist Back Take
why: You lose the underhook on the leg
description: Go tight waist and put your other foot across, behind that same knee you just lost the hook on, climbing up to the top position.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Reap from the back
why: You lose the underhook on the leg and they rotate out
description: Throw your leg over the top into an inside reap.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Elevate to SingleLegX
why: x
description: Reach for their knee on the same side as the Shin to Shin hook, elbow deep, while keeping the elbow to knee frame on the far side. Pull them back onto you, and turn yourself to the inside while flaring your knee out. Drag the leg over your knee, and then bring your foot up and over their leg onto their hip.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: False Reap
why: They step inside
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Farside Armbar
why: x
description: Get a deep underhook on the far side and step over their head. Spin to the other side, and throw that leg over their waist to secure the Armbar.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Bread Cutter lapel choke
why: You get the underhook, but they frame on your face.
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Back Take
why: They put their arm across to your far hip
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Hip Block, North South transition
why: They get the underhook, but don't come up
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Baratoplata
why: They get the underhook, and start to come up
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Nearside Hook Back Take
why: x
description: Starting with double unders grips, raise the near side arm and throw your hook in. Reach over the far shoulder and take a meatball grip under their shoulder and behind their head. Wrench them down to the mat, pulling up on the grip.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Heel to knee back take
why: They close the space for the neadside hook
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Over the top back take
why: They block the nearside hook, and then roll away
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Handcuff Armbar
why: They seperate your hands and start walking their hips away
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Handcuff Omoplata
why: As you attack the Handcuff armbar, they hide their arms
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Reverse X Reap
why: They stand and run
description: While keeping a strong frame with your hands, backstep your bottom leg, dropping your knee behind theirs and collecting the legs.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Kick through Inside Reap
why: They stand and run
description: Kick through Inside Reap
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Seated Kick back inside Reap
why: They sit to the mat or fall
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Wrist Drag Single Leg
why: x
description: Pass the wrist to the cross hand, taking a big step to the side and shooting in for the single leg.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Switch to Russian 2 on 1 Grip
why: You get a deep grip, they post on your head
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Sweep single the far leg
why: They pull their arm out early
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Pummel the undehook on the far side
why: They pull their arm out early, and sprawl
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Arm Drag to Tight Waist
why: x
description: Reach across with your free hand and take a deep grip behind their tricep, just below their armpit. Push the wrist across your waist to the other side, as you pull the tricep grip through. When the wrist gets to the other side of your waist, release it and reach around their back, finishing with a tight waist.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: ArmDrag inside hook takedown
why: You get a grip, but they pull back and circle
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Pummel for the underhook on the far side
why: They pull back early and post on you with their far arm
description: Duck and circle under the post, as you hit the sweep single on the far side.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Snapdown to Head and Arm Control
description: Pull down on the Collar Tie and the elbow, dropping your weight at the same time. As their posture falls, come over the top of their head with your arm, securing Head and Arm control.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Snapdown to Sweep Single
why: They posture and come back up, stepping forward
description: Pull down on the Collar Tie and the elbow, dropping your weight at the same time. When they come up, you stay down and shoot in for the sweep single.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Duck under single leg
why: They keep their posture and their arm above yours
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Driving Ankle Pick
why: x
description: As soon as you get the underhook, drive forward with it, collapsing to the mat and diving on the far ankle or knee.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Tight waist back take
why: They turn away and give up and angle to their back?
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Over Under Inside Hook Takedown
why: They fire the underhook on the opposite side, stopping you from turning them or ankle picking.
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Overhook Judo Throw
why: x
description: Pressuring down with your shoulder amd the overhook, take a grip on the far arm at the elbow. Put in your inside hook and elevate them forward, turning them down and circling forthe takedown.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Head and Arm Control snapdown
why: They bend forward and post
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Cross leg inside trip
why: They are jumping with their far leg and you can't elevate them
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Switch to Russian
why: They release thier underhook
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Russian Back Take
why: x
description: Drive them to the mat. Step behind their foot, and circle to their back.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Russian back trip
why: They pull back hard
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Head Post Sweep Single
why: x
description: Tap the head, and replace your hand with your other hand. Push off the head as you lower your level and shoot for the sweep single.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Opposite side Sweep Single
why: They circle into you
description: x
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Circling Pass
why: They put you back in Open Guard Passing
description: Upsidedown grip, circling, making your way to a overhook on the head.
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: They frame and square up, creating a Leg Drag fight

name: Far Side Leg Drag
why: They frame, turn, and square up with you
description: As they frame and start to square up, drive them over to the leg drag on the far side.
b2: They frame and square up, creating a Leg Drag fight

name: Duck Under
why: They bring there leg over the top and try to collect your knee
description: Keep pinning the bottom leg down, while you duck under the top leg and pass on the other side.
b2: They pass their leg over you head, putting you in Double Unders Pass

name: Crab Ride
why: They invert through to a Kiss of the Dragon back take
description: As they invert through for the KoD back take, you counter by diving through to a crab ride.
b2: They invert, putting you in a Crab Ride fight

name: Shoulder Push Foot Lift
why: They are playing defence in Seated Guard
description: Shoulder push, 2 on 1 grip on the foot, pulling and lifting.

name: Nearside Knee Cut
why: They over-extend their leg, reaching in HG
description: As they over-extend their leg reaching for a connection, knee cut through.
b2: They frame and square up, creating a Leg Drag fight

name: Kimura
why: They over-extend their arm, reaching in HG
description: As they over-extend their arm reaching for your knee, reach over and jump the kimura.
b2: They pass their leg over you head, putting you in Double Unders Pass

name: Winshield Wiper
why: They repummel the foot to Shin to Shin
description: As they repummel the foot to Shin to Shin, windshield wiper your foot inside.
b2: They invert, putting you in a Crab Ride fight

name: Knee Cut (near side)
why: They put you back in Half Guard
description: Crushing the knee down, connecting your hands underneath, and smash passing through.
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Farside Knee Cut
why: They frame and block your knee cut
description: When they frame and block your knee cut, lift the knee and drive it across to HQ.
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Shin Smash Pancake Pass
why: They frame and block your knee cut, and keep a very high knee shield
description: As they frame and block your knee cut with a high knee shield, pressure the shin, walk them.
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Crab Ride
why: They take RDL grip, invert through to a Kiss of the Dragon back take
description: As they invert through for the KoD back take, you counter by diving through to a crab ride.
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Leg Drag
why: The reap the top leg over for false reap
description: As they reap the top leg over for false reap, drag it all the way through and Leg Drag.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Body Lock KneeCut
why: They put you back in Half Guard
description: Smash their knee, body lock, get instep, nearside KneeCut.

name: Body Lock Switch Pass
why: They turn their knee down into you to stop the pass
description: As they turn their knee down, bring your top knee over it , and pass to the far side.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Nearside KneeCut w Instep
why: They underhook on the nearside and open your bodylock
description: Weave your arm in to get the instep, hips up, nearside kneecut.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Instep-trap Walkover
why: They high knee shield to stop your overhook
description: Hug the leg, trapping it with your shoulder on the instep of their foot, and your arm on your hip. Walk them over and pancake pass.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Backstep pass
description: Push the foot on your hip away, push the foot in between your leg down, then backstep the X guard.
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Push it down to Mount
why: Knee hook is weak or shallow
description: Push it down to Mount
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Double Unders Pass2
why: x
description: Double Unders Pass
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Double Unders Pass2
why: x
description: Double Unders Pass
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Pancake Pass
why: Bring their leg over the top
description: Smash the leg, cover, pancake pass.
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Nearside KneeCut
why: They frame and block your knee
description: Hip switch to the other side, push the knee throught your legs, and kneecut through on the nearside.
b1: Nothing, you pass to side control
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Body Lock Pass
why: They frame and block your knee, and stop you from pushing their knee
description: As they stop you from pushing their knee through, drop your shoulder and reach under them on the nearside, as you bring your knee over theirs and secure the body lock.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Double Underhooks to Mount
why: x
description: Using the double underhooks to anchor, alternate between the longstep, and stepping over to the mount.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Double Unders Tripod Pass
why: You can't longstep or step over the knee while postured.
description: You can't longstep or step over the knee while postured, so take the overhook with a grip at the elbow and dive your head down and tripod. Push the foot down with your elbow, and step over to mount.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Over/Under Tripod Pass
why: They pummel the nearside arm in
description: When they pummel the nearside arm in, take the overhook with a grip at the elbow, dive your head down and tripod. Push the foot down with your elbow, and step over to mount.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Same side knee cut to headquarters
why: x
description: Get double shallow underhooks. Drive your knee across on the same side to the Headquarters position
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Half Butterfly Attacking
why: They trap you in half butterfly
description: Continue to Half Butterfly Attacking
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard

name: Hip switch pass
why: They square up and stop you from driving the knee
description: Take double underhooks and pressure forward. Kicking your legs behind you, flattening your hips and twisting to get one of their feet trapped across your waist. Push their knee down and knee cut through to pass.
b2: You get put back in standard half-guard
